title: Rng (algebra)
summary: In mathematics, and more specifically in abstract algebra, a rng (or non-unital ring or pseudo-ring) is an algebraic structure satisfying the same properties as a ring, but without assuming the existence of a multiplicative identity. The term rng (IPA: /rʊŋ/) is meant to suggest that it is a ring without i, that is, without the requirement for an identity element.
